column6: Best silver toner for blonde hair
column9: Reviewed in the United States on December 5, 2018
column14: My hair would definitely be married to this product. It does it’s job to maintain all my unicorn hair dreams for a long time. And the fade out is phenomenal. I’ve had the blue, silver/purple,rose/lavender hair and I have to say this product is bomb. You won’t regret adding it to your shower lineup. My tones typically last awhile before it starts to fade but even after 6 months before the next tone session, my hair has not turned a single time orange. Advice: buy this size and add the pump so you don’t have to fiddle with the cap every time.

column9: Reviewed in the United States on January 24, 2020
column14: Love this shampoo for my blonde going white 50+ year old hair.  Currently I have no addt'l highlights added and w this shampoo am done doing any more again.

column9: Reviewed in the United States on July 10, 2021
column14: I used this purple shampoo a few years ago when my stylist had some for sale in her salon. I bought a bottle and used it occasionally. Now, I've gone darker with just a few highlights and those highlights tend to turn yellow and orange. I tried the Matrix Brass Off brand and it made my hands and head itch pretty badly. So, I was trying to remember what the brand was that I'd used. I called the Salon and they told me it was this AG brand. Bought another bottle and it works just as well as I remember. And no itchy hands when applying (and after) or itchy scalp. Works great!

column6: This shampoo& conditioner + fanola an you got a winner!!!
column9: Reviewed in the United States on March 11, 2021
column14: It took 3 years to get ash blond gray hair... This is what I use to keep the brass out... And keep my hair a cool color... I bought the shampoo an conditioner... I use it like once a week... It doesn't leave your hair feeling dried out. I also have fanola purple shampoo and use that once or twice a month... It's better than all of ulta's purple shampoos but it's harsh so I counteract it with olaplex to keep my hair healthy... With all of the shampoos I notice that if you put it on dry hair until saturated an sit for 10-15 min it comes out nicer...

column6: Keeps Gray/silver/white hair from getting yellowish tinge
column9: Reviewed in the United States on December 26, 2017
column14: Originally purchased this brand at Ulta.  Better price at Amazon.  Works well on my silver gray hair to keep it from getting that yellowish tinge.

column9: Reviewed in the United States on April 18, 2019
column14: I love this shampoo! It’s the best purple shampoo I’ve used. It gives my hair strength, volume, and shine. Exit brassiness; enter expensive highlights. Highlights are expensive. Why not show them off?! (My highlights were done 4 months ago.)

column6: It makes a big difference. Better much better
column9: Reviewed in the United States on December 12, 2018
column14: I was given a sample of this by a friend that used to be in the business and this is what she uses...I just frosted my brown hair with blond highlight, this would get brassy looking as the days passed, this shampoo fixes this and makes a big difference and to tell the truth I usually can’t get enthusiastic about these things but I do like this very much...

column9: Reviewed in the United States on September 6, 2018
column14: My hair dresser recommended I get this purple shampoo and while I think it probably kept my hair from getting too brassy, I do not think it worked as well as other purple shampoos I have used. She recommended it because it is paraben free which is better for your hair but I only use a purple shampoo once a week. A plus: it does not dye your hands or shower purple when you use it.

column9: Reviewed in the United States on June 3, 2020
column14: Extremely disappointed in this product as it smells absolutely awful, like a really strong plastic smell. Lost 2 stars because of it. I was expecting a pleasant smell like the other Milkshake products I have used. Maybe this was old stock? I'm using it anyway as I don't want to throw my money down the drain. The conditioner smells just as bad! Aside from the horrid smell, it seems to work well.  Most products weigh my hair down and this doesn't. It leaves my hair feeling light and super soft. Helps control the flyaways and leaves my hair manageable.  I just wish the smell wasn't so bad. I doubt I'll order this again due the strong plastic odor.

column9: Reviewed in the United States on December 5, 2019
column14: Besides having a delicious scent the shampoo works well in hard water which we have in our area. My hair stylist recommended it. After she used it on my hair I bought some for home and have continued to enjoy how my hair looks after shampooing. I also bought the accompanying conditioner which is applied after shampooing and left in the hair. I have been so satisfied that I have continued to purchase Milk Shake shampoo and conditioner.
